name: Perfect Thanksgiving Stuffing
ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh sage, minced fine (you may substitute 2 T rubbed dry sage, but be careful)
1 gallon semi-­‐dry bread, medium diced (day old)
1 QT turkey stock (may substitute CP chicken stock as needed)
1. Melt butter in a large stock pot
2. Add onions and celery and sweat over medium heat til translucent (uncovered until translucent)
3. Add sage and stir to combine (brings out oils)
4. Place bread in a large mixing bowl
5. Combine onion and celery mixture with bread and toss to combine
6. Moisten the bread with the stock until it is damp but not drenched
7. Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper
8. Bake uncovered in a shallow baking dish until golden brown.
9. Please make note not to pack the bread mixture in the baking dish too tightly to avoid steaming the
steps: Cook 45-­‐50 minutes (doesn't have the temp. so I would guess at 350, but not totally sure).
